page.title: 03Henstead Church
page.content: Henstead Church is situated on the outskirts of the village and is surrounded by beautiful countryside. It was built in the 12th century and has a beautiful Norman doorway. It is made of flint, stones and granite and inside there are four large oak beams. The windows on the south side were renewed at the beginning of the second world war and were replaced with plain glass. Recently replaced windows have been set straight into stone rather than lead or timber and are cracking due to the heavy traffic alongside the church. Any new windows will definately be set into lead so that they can give a little. Apparently Lushes of Norwich hold the contract for any new windows. Henstead Church has a thatched roof which was completely rethatched 55 years ago. 9 years ago the S side was rethatched.
